solution_line_template: The storm dropped {initial_rainfall} inches then half that amount so {initial_rainfall}/{half_divisor} = <<{initial_rainfall}/{half_divisor}={second_period_rainfall}>>{second_period_rainfall} inches

The next hour the storm dropped {third_period_rainfall_per_hour} inch of rain for {third_period_duration_hours} hour so {third_period_duration_hours}*{third_period_rainfall_per_hour} = <<{third_period_duration_hours}*{third_period_rainfall_per_hour}={third_period_rainfall}>>{third_period_rainfall} inches

All total the storm dropped {initial_rainfall} inches + {second_period_rainfall} inches + {third_period_rainfall} inch for = <<{initial_rainfall}+{second_period_rainfall}+{third_period_rainfall}={total_rainfall}>>{total_rainfall} inches
It rained for {total_duration_hours} hours total so {total_rainfall}/{total_duration_hours} = <<{total_rainfall}/{total_duration_hours}={average_rainfall}>>{average_rainfall} inches of rain per hour
